title: aldi bring back christmas favourite brits prepare celebrate junemas
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAs anticipation builds for lockdown restrictions lting completely on June , Brits are gearing up to enjoy the Christmas we never had on June .With limited celebrations in December amid coronavirus lockdown restrictions research has shown that nearly half of Britsare planning to celebrate lsquoJunemasrsquo with friends and family next month.Itrsquos clear with December lockdown now a distant memory, the thought of Christmas and being reunited with our friends and family has us feeling all sentimental.And to help Brits celebrate the festivities, Aldi is bringing back its popular Specially Selected Mini Mince Pies." alt"Penarth Times: Specially Selected Mini Mince Pies. " class"editor-image"Specially Selected Mini Mince Pies. When asked what festive food they would most like to see back on shelves this Junemas, half of Britslisted mince pies as their quintessential Christmas treat.Web searches for lsquomince piesrsquo also went up by an incredible % in April alone, as the nation prepares to celebrate Christmas this summer.With % of people planning a lockdown-lting party, the most popular celebration is set to be with our closest friends, with over % of those polled looking forward to being reunited with pals theyrsquove missed, closely followed by get-togethers with extended family .Julie Ashfield, Managing Director of Buying at Aldi, commented: ldquoThe first Friday post-lockdown will feel like Christmas, as we all get to meet up with friends and family after months apart.ldquoWe thought letrsquos make it a Junemas to remember by bringing back the nations festive favourite - mince pies - to help celebrate this very special occasion!Aldirsquos Specially Selected Mini Mince Pies will be available for pound. in-store nationwide from st June.Follow Aldi as it gears up for the summer celebrations on #AldiJunemas where shoppers can cast their vote on what other yuletide favourites they would like to see back in store for Junemas. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: new pathway college commence university south wales
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe pathway and English-language programmes will support students who need to develop their English-language ability and academic study skills to offer guaranteed progression routes into business, computing, engineering, and creative industries, with applied science and sports science on offer at a later date.QAHE is well-established in the international pathways market, with partnerships in place with Northumbria University, University of Roehampton, and Solent University, as well as other Higher Education partnerships with Ulster University, Middlesex University, and London politan University.It has strong international recruitment and marketing capabilities, including a large network of international representatives and a strong track record of progression in the classroom with its university partners. The first cohort of students will commence in autumn .MORE NEWS:Professor Julie Lydon, USW Vice-Chancellor, said: ldquoIrsquom delighted that the University of South Wales has been able to secure this partnership with QAHE, which has a track record of delivering similar provision to overseas students at a number of UK institutions.ldquoBy recognising the needs of a wider section of international students and providing them with the support to reach their potential, we will further enhance our reputation as an international institution that offers world-leading qualications.ldquoAt USW, we have many yearsrsquo experience of providing first-class learning to students from across the globe, and we can use this expertise to ensure these integrated programmes provide the next generation of students with an education that is second to none.     Growing its international footprint is a strategic priority for USW. As well as supporting the delivery of the wider internationalisation strategy, the partnership will further enhance ersity across the international cohort and provide a new channel of recruitment that will help to future-proof the University against the impacts of Brexit and an increasingly challenging international sector.Julie Noone, Chief Executive of QAHE, said: ldquoWe are delighted to be working with University of South Wales on this new partnership which will provide increased subject and location choices for International students within the QAHE portfolio of partners and courses.ldquoUSW has very strong International ambitions and we are very happy to be working with a new partner with such ambition in this area.The campuses and range of subjects are outstanding and extremely attractive for International students.Further information about the partnership and the courses available are on the QA Higher Education website https:qahighereducation . article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth school celebrates teacher heroes teacher appreciation week
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe school, which has recently reopened its doors following the national school closures, has been applauded by parents for its handling of the pandemic and the focus placed throughout lockdown on pupil safety and wellbeing.This month sees students, parents and friends of the school, in the local community and further afield, come together to pay tribute to Westbournersquos teaching heroes.These are teachers who routinely go above and beyond their normal teaching duties ndash including providing unprecedented levels of support to pupils during the pandemic, both academically and pastorally initiating new ways of thinking and learning during lockdown to help pupils thrive and participating in initiatives outside school to help those in need in the wider community.Heres some of their teacher heroes:Year  teacher, Jessica ArmstrongThe inspirational DofE leader helping women and children in need.She is currently spearheading the Duke of Edinburgh Award scheme at the school, and also leads a iety of extra-curricular student groups including Running Club and Maths Booster Club to help pupils transition back to Maths class following lockdown.On Saturday she led a Duke of Edinburgh expedition training weekend for Year ,  and Sixth Form, where pupils learnt vital survival skills such as understanding kit and equipment, map reading and route planning, cooking and first aid.She accompanied pupils on a six-hour orienteering session, covering km through Dyffryn and Wenvoe.In addition to her day job, she is also involved with the charity Cardf Womens Aid which helps women and children who have been victims of domestic abuse and gender-based violence in often le-threatening situations.She has worked with the charity on setting up an Information Hub for women looking for support and advice.     Deputy Manager of Little Westbourne Nursery, Hannah BennettThe nursery leader who helped raise pound,She has worked tirelessly over the past year to ensure the wellbeing and happiness of the children in her care.She worked to keep the nursery running efficiently and safely during lockdown, when many local nurseries had closed their doors, manning the nursery with one other colleague for the children of key workers in addition to rolling out a lively programme of daily online learning and motivational activities for children at home. During lockdown, she also led one-to-one Zoom sessions with children and their parents to ensure the highest levels of pastoral support.She went above and beyond her normal teaching duties when, in March , she helped organise a fundraising campaign in aid of the Downrsquos Syndrome Association, inspired by a child close to the heart of Little Westbourne Nursery, raising an incredible pound,.Stuart Ayres, Director of Online LearningThe innovative teacher helping students gain new skills during lockdownWestbourne is one of the first schools in Wales to use AItechnology to help pupils learn.It was also ahead of the curve in its appointment of a Director of Online Education before the UK went into lockdown, meaning that Westbourne could move seamlessly to a full online learning offering from Day  of the nationwide school closures.Director of Online Learning, Stuart Ayres, established an innovative tech partnership that enabled the school to deliver a ground-breaking online learning  backed by articial intelligence and the latest thinking in neuroscience.MORE NEWS:The  works by generating mini-lessons that students use to complement their studies. If a student requires guidance in a particular academic area, the  recognises this and recommends mini-lessons to improve understanding.It can even do this in a cross-curricular sense, for example suggesting English mini-lessonsa studentrsquos misunderstanding of a Maths problem is based on a comprehension error. It also recognises when a student needs to be challenged, recommending limitless supplementary material in the core areas of English, Maths and Science.Westbourne School is based on Hickman Road, Penarth. Picture: Westbourne School Stuart Ayres said: ldquoDuring lockdown, we continued to explore new ways of teaching, new resources and cutting-edge technologies to support pupils at every stage.ldquoUniquely, Westbourne offered a combination of heavily personalised learning alongside the latest in AI-assisted learning technology, which undoubtedly helped our pupils to thrive."There has been concern in the media about students losing skills and academic knowledge during lockdown - it was quite the opposite in our case."Students actually came back to school with more refined digital skills than before, thanks to the new technology.ldquoArticial intelligence has now become part of the make-up of the school, and we continue to use it to enhance learning now that we are back in the physical classroom."In doing so wersquove been able to elevate the student experience at Westbourne to a whole new - and very exciting ndash level.Principal of Westbourne School, Dr Gerard Grfiths, said: ldquoWe count ourselves very lucky at Westbourne to have such a talented and dedicated teaching team. Teachers here regularly go far beyond what is required of them to support, motivate and engage pupils at an extremely high level.ldquoItrsquos only fitting that we take this opportunity, during Teacher Appreciation Week, to discuss and celebrate all that our teachers do on a daily basis, both in and out of school."Even during the pandemic, when the odds have been stacked against us all, their love for the job and desire to see pupils succeed has been unwavering. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth library reopens refurbishment
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFunded jointly by the Vale of Glamorgan Council and Welsh Government, the redecorated ground floor includes new furniture, enquiry desk, carpet and shelving.LED lighting has been installed throughout the building, which has also seen many of its features revived.The new entrance foyer reflects the libraryrsquos traditional architecture, while a commemorative plaque, Samuel Thomas bust and original tiles have all been restored.Additional repairs to the roof around the clock tower have also been carried out.As with other Vale of Glamorgan libraries, a number of Covid-related safety features have been introduced to help protect visitors.There are -minute book browsing sessions available along with -minute slots for computer use, which must be booked in advance by contacting the respective library.Fixed time limits will also mean staff can properly sanitise machines between uses.There are also plans to temporarily move some of the childrenrsquos stock and services to Penarth Pier Pavilion.MORE NEWS:This is so that the regular programme of childrenrsquos activities, including Rhyme  Sign and Story Times, can take place in a larger space this summer.More information about this will be provided through Penarth Libraryrsquos social media accounts in the coming weeks.Cllr Lis Burnett, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet member for Education and Regeneration said: ldquoPenarth Library has undergone comprehensive upgrading work and I canrsquot wait for people to see the changes.ldquoMany of the traditional features have been restored and some new touches have also been added.ldquoPenarth, along with other Vale libraries, is now open again to the public after a range of measures were introduced to keep people safe.     Library services were initially suspended in an effort to tackle the coronavirus before a click-and-collect service was launched in late June.That allows members to borrow books, audiobooks and DVDs on an appointment basis and submit preference requests relating to authors or genres.For the time being, chairs have been removed from the libraries to discourage sitting, toilets will be closed to the public and there will be no meetings, activities or room bookings available.Anyone entering the building will be asked to use hand gel and complete a track and trace card giving their name and contact details.Library staff will work behind protective screens when at a desk and wear masks at other times and all books will be quarantined for  hours before being cleaned and put back into circulation.Current weekday opening times at Penarth, Barry, Llantwit Major and Cowbridge libraries are am to pm and pm to pmThe Libraries are also open from am untilpm, and pm untilpm on Saturdays. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth man ordered repay   selling counterfeit goods
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySean Payter was convicted in  following a Trading Standards investigation for the Vale of Glamorgan Council and today faced a Proceeds of Crime Hearing.There the judge decided he must repay a signicant sum gained from his illegal activity over the next three months.Shared Regulatory Services , who undertake trading standards work across the Local Authority areas of Bridgend, Cardf and the Vale, began investigating Mr Payter after receiving a complaint from the Assay Office, the body responsible for testing and hallmarking precious metals.The Assay Office had carried out a test purchase from gemgems, a company operated by Payter and Stefan Hodgson from Newport, that sold jewellery on eBay.It revealed that an item was not silver as described and did not contain the advertised gem stones.Further testing by SRS found that other items of jewellery were also misdescribed and that cosmetics being sold were unsafe and possibly infringed trademarks.After executing a warrant for the home of Payter, SRS officers seized jewellery, cosmetics and pound, in cash.The investigation showed that Payter and Hodgson had been trading for five years and at one point ran a website calledgemsgems.MORE NEWS:Check out these photos of the ambitious transformation at Whitmore High SchoolNew Pathway College announced at University of South WalesOutdoor show to come to Barrys MEMO Arts Centre later this month!They had been buying items such as necklaces, bracelets, bangles and earrings from a website in China without verying that they were as described.Counterfeit cufflinks and belts were also identied along with cosmetics that werenrsquot safe to be used.Payter, from St Davids Cresent in Penarth and Hodgson, of Park Drive Newport, both plead guilty to  offences in total two under Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations, six under the Hallmarking Act, two under Cosmetic Product Enforcement Regulations and two under the Trademarks Act.     In August  they were sentenced to a total of  months in prison, reduced to  months for early guilty pleas, suspended for  months. The pair also had to pay a victim surcharge of pound each.Cllr Eddie Williams, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Legal, Regulatory and Planning Services, said: ldquoThis was a despicable operation that took money from members of the public for items that were not what they purported to be."Great work by Shared Regulatory Services has led to this prosecution, which ensures that no more people will fall victim to this company.ldquoI welcome the signicant sum Mr Payter has been told to repay, which reflects the amount of money he made from the operation.ldquoThis case should serve as a warning to others operating illegally within our community. The Council will actively look to protect our residents and will not hesitate to take actionwe find people are not operating within the parameters of the law. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: mcdonalds scrap popular items menu make way  new offerings
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFast food lovers will know, the UKrsquos most popular burger chain regularly updates its menu throughout the year with promotions to keep their offerings fresh.From this week, McDonaldrsquos has unveiled five new items that will be available to customers until mid-June.The new products will be part of the chains menu from May  to June  meaning you will only have a short time to sample their new offerings.One of the items making ais a firm favourite among McDonaldrsquos lovers, the Bacon Clubhouse Double.The burger consists of two % beef patties, two rashers of Beechwood smoked bacon, a slice of cheddar cheese, onions, tomato, lettuce, and sauce.Another item being added to the menu is the Chicken Deluxe Sandwich.A chicken option consisting of two crunchy Chicken Selects, Emmental cheese, lettuce, red onions, tomato relish, and mayonnaise. Both items will cost pound. each." alt"Penarth Times: Two new burgers will be making ato the menu. " class"editor-image"Two new burgers will be making ato the menu. Another item making ato the menu is the Cheese and Herb Melts. Priced at pound., the cheesy treats come in a pack of five and accompanied with a delicious tomato and herb sauce.McDonaldrsquos is also mixing it up with their McFlurryrsquos with Galaxy and Galaxy Caramel flavours making ato the menu.Both feature Galaxy chocolate chunks with either chocolate or caramel sauce and cost pound..Now that you have had the good news, to make way for the new items McDonaldrsquos is having to scrap a number of items that have proven popular with customers.One of which is the Big Tasty burger which was removed on May  alongside the Chicken BBQ Smokehouse burger.To make way for the Galaxy McFlurryrsquos, McDonaldrsquos has also revealed the Cadbury Cregraveme Egg and the Cadbury Caramel flavours are being scrapped.The items were reintroduced to the McDonaldrsquos menu in March when customers were warned they would only be available until May.However, with how often the menu changes it is likely customers will see them make ato the menu sometime in the future. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: meet penarth man designed new town parklets
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJohn Davies, owner ofCandid Creative Studio, worked with the Vale of Glamorgan Council on the parklets after taking part in a competition to design and manage the installation of artwork to celebrate Penarth.In all it took around a month to complete, from the initial conceptualisation meetings through to agreeing the final artwork.ldquoWe carefully balanced the needs for the parklets to have an identity, promote and shout about Penarth, and also appeal to the public at large, he said.Parklets are extensions of trading space built out into existing parking bays that allow businesses to safely accommodate a greater number of customers.D signs of Bridgend fitted the vinyl artwork just in time for outdoor hospitality to open on Monday, April .ldquoIt is Penarthrsquos very own unique and erse architectural heritage which formed the inspiration to the parklets artwork, he added.ldquoThe townrsquos famous landmarks, as well as some lesser known ones, join quirky seaside elements, to decorate the glass .The parklets offer a great opportunity for hospitality businesses to welcome back customers, with some shelter, while they cannot currently open inside.MORE NEWS:lsquoHe will always be in my heartrsquo: Woman raises over pound, in memory of childhood friendPenarth man ordered to repay pound, after selling counterfeit goodsCan you help  Appeal after boombox, toilet and more dumped at Vale parkThe final designed parklets can be seen outside Willmorersquos  on Stanwell Road, and Foxys Deli, Victoria Roadand Gin .ldquoOutside the business opportunities, on a sunny day they also animate Penarthrsquos streets, encourage residents and tourists to stay a little longer in the town and enjoy everything Penarth has he added.ldquoBusinesses and the public alike have enjoyed using the parklets since last week, and feedback on the artwork has been very positive.     For Mr Daviesrsquo graphic design businesses, he says the last few months since the lockdown on December  has lsquoremained steady.rsquoldquoI am very lucky to work with a range of clients ndash the NHS, national charities, ambitious locals, small businesses, and everyone in between ndash who have needed to adapt themselves to the changing landscape caused by the pandemic.ldquoThat ability to stay nimble has allowed my clients to weather the storm so far, and I am faithful that will continue as we see the pandemic in the rear view mirror. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: rnli penarth looking lifeboat station historian
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe role will see them revealing the stories behind the townrsquos leboat station since it re-opened in , as well as collecting information and statistics on the boats and launches.The volunteer will research and collect oral histories from the many people who have been involved with the station over the years.From past boat crew and family members to the hundreds of volunteers and people throughout the community who have come into contact with the station over the last .RNLI Penarthrsquos first leboat station was built in  for a cost of pound, before being relocated in  when Penarth Esplanade was constructed.The station closed in , and the town had no leboat station for another  years. Not until the increasing popularity of Penarth as a destination for tourism and leisure boating saw the need for leboat services to be re-established in .MORE NEWS:#The current purpose-built station was constructed in .The history of the th century station has been well-documented, but not its history since , which is what this new role will uncover.Laurie Pavelin, chair of RNLI Penarth Leboat Station, said: ldquoPenarthrsquos leboat station has been a central part of the community since , and in that time it has played a part in many peoplersquos lives.ldquoThe people of Penarth have volunteered, fundraised, attended events, brought safety lessons to schools, and played a part in RNLIrsquos lesaving work in so many dferent ways.ldquoWersquore looking forward to welcoming a new volunteer historian who will make sure those stories are preserved for the community. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: senedd election  vaughan gething retains seat
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local community.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething at the count for the Senedd elections iltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgtn the House of Sportltspan classtruncate-full-screengt, Cardf today.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething with his son and we celebrating afterltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt winning Cardf Soultspan classtruncate-full-screengtth and Penarth during the count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething celebrating after winning Cardf Southltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt and Penarth during ltspan classtruncate-full-screengtthe count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentVAUGHAN Gething has retained his seat in the Senedd.Mr Gething, who has represented Cardf South and Penarth since , has secured his seat by a majority of more than , votes.The Labour representative received , votes."Im delighted with the result," he said."A really strong showing across Cardf South and Penarth. When we saw the boxes being opened in Penarth we also saw there was a very strong showing there."It was hard to tell how all of the votes scattered amongst the fringe parties, but in the main parties it was clear that we were going to have a good result."When asked about what is in store for next term, he said: "Well we need to see what the national results are, and Ive still got choices to make as the health minister until a new government is formed."Some of those are still big and dficult, and I think its part of the reason why people renwed their faith in us and that is because they recognise there are still challenges to navigate our way through."But I really do look forward to within tis next term being able to see people in a more normal way - to go to more community events and have more of the person to person contact weve all missed in this last year and more."This year saw a sizeable increase in voter turnout with , votes cast- . per cent - compared to . per cent in .The full results for Cardf South and Penarth are as follows:Vaughan Gething- ,Leighton Rowlands- ,Nasir Adam- ,Helen Westhead- ,Alex Wilson- ,Paul Campbell- Lisa Peregrine- Matt Friend- Alan Pick- Alan Golding- David Rolfe- Angus Hawkins-  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Watch: Senedd Election : Meet the new MSs for South Wales CentralAndrew RT Davies" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentBOTH the Conservative and Plaid Cymru won two seats in the South Wales Central region.Rhys ap Owen and Heledd Fychan were elected for Plaid, with Welsh Conservative leader Andrew RT Davies retaining his seat in the region, along with Joel James.Neither Mr Davies nor Mr Jones attended the count at the Barry Memo Arts Centre today, despite the Welsh Conservatives securingtheir best ever Senedd result ndash winning  seats.On the partys overall result, Mr Davies said: ldquoFirstly, Irsquod like to say a huge thank you to our outstanding set of Welsh Conservative candidates, activists and staff whorsquove worked incredibly hard throughout this campaign and secured the partys best ever Senedd result.ldquoThe team has gone above and beyond and deserve great credit for the positive campaign wersquove run right across Wales, and I am thrilled to see Natasha Asghar make history in South Wales East by becoming the first female from a BAME background to be elected to the Senedd.ldquoAs a party we are also delighted to have secured constituency seats in the Vale of Clwyd and Brecon and Radnorshire, and increased seats on the regional lists, resulting in our highest ever representation in the Senedd with  members.ldquoItrsquos been an unconventional campaign and itrsquos clear incumbency and continuity has played a signicant part. To that end, I would like to offer my sincere congratulations to Mark Drakeford and Welsh Labour on a successful campaign.ldquoThe election has been fought in good spirit by political parties in Wales and I would like to pay a final word of thanks to the many officials across the country whorsquove allowed this election to take place in a safe and effective manner.Plaid Cymru gained an extra seat this election, which was occupied by Ukip in , secured  seats in the Senedd in total and meant Labour fell short of a majority in Wales.Speaking on the win, Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru said she feels ldquoincredibly honoured, humbled and excited and that there will be a lot of ldquoreading and preparing in the coming days.     Spoke with @heleddfychan after Plaid secured two seats at the South Wales Central counts #SeneddVote pic GKeJwmdash BrookeMay , ldquoI know the first thing that I want to focus on in the Senedd is fighting for independent inquiry into the  floods that devastated communities from the Vale of Glamorgan right to the Cynon Valley.ldquoSo thatrsquos definitely one of my first priorities.ldquoGiven that we werenrsquot able to campaign until April  or knock any doors Irsquom extremely proud that wersquove achieved an increase in number of members we have in the Senedd.Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyldquoPersonally in Pontypridd we raised the vote by four percent, which I was incredibly proud of and I think the fact that we have so many new, fresh faces coming to the Senedd means that there is a lot of excitement about what we will be able to achieve as a group.Mr ap Owen added: "Its sinking in now slowly. It always looked likely that we were going to get regional seats here in South Wales Central but we dont quite believe it until it actually happens."Rhys ap Owen of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyHe says that campaigning during the coronavirus pandemic has been "dficult" and "unusual.""Usually we would be knocking doors for well over a year before an election and we havent been able to do that so it has been a very dferent election to any I have experienced."The full results are below:Welsh Labour ndash ,Welsh Conservatives ndash ,Plaid Cymru - ,Wales Green Party ndash ,Welsh Liberal Democrats ndash ,Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party - ,Propel - ,Ukip - Scrap the Assembly Senedd ndash ,Reform UK - ,No More Lockdowns - ,Gwlad - The Welsh Independence Party - ,Britains Communist Party - Alan Coulthard ndash Trade Unionist and Socialist Coalition - Workers Party ndash  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: labours alun michael re elected south wales pcc
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAlun Michael" Labours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCC for third timeAlun Edward Michael" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentALUN Michael has been re-elected as the Police and Crime Commissioner for South Wales.The Welsh Labour politician has been serving as the PCC since the role was created in , and will continue to do so for another four years after winning  per cent of the total vote.Conservative candidate Steve Gallagher came in second with  per cent.Among first preference votes, Mr Michael received , ndash or . percent ndash falling short of the  per cent needed to win re-election.Alun Michael speaking after his winOnce the top two were confirmed, the second preference votes were counted ndash those whose first choice was eliminated ndash which saw Mr Michael elected with , votes, and Steve Gallagher had ,.Speaking on his win, Mr Michael said: ldquoItrsquos been a very strange election, coming as it does in the period of Covid-.ldquoSo my first thanks are to the other candidates who have shown stamina through that period.MORE NEWS:ldquoWe took part in a number of speech debates and they were constructed exchanges about things that matter to the electorate of South Wales.ldquoThank you to all the staff who have been involved in the count, including the police officers who have been here to deal with any outbreaks but fortunately they havenrsquot had to deal with.ldquoYou have all shown incredible stamina throughout the last few days with the challenges of the count in this period of Covid-.ldquoAnd thank you in particular to the electorate of South Wales across the  constituencies. I take very seriously indeed the responsibilities the votes cast today place on my shoulders in trying to deliver and to continue to improve the effectiveness of policing.ldquoMy commitment is to do that with renewed energy.     The job of a PCC is to oversee how crime is tackled in their area. They hold their forces to account and set local force priorities and budgets. They also scrutinise the chief constable with the power to appoint and dismiss them.They also work with local partners to prevent crime. The hope is that their democratic mandate from the public makes them more accountable and able to respond to local peoplersquos concerns.First preference votes:Second preference votes:Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: small whale freed becoming stranded along river thames
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityHundreds gathered at Richmond Lock and Weir after the whale, believed to be a Minke and between three to four metres long, became stuck on the lockrsquos boat rollers.Videos showed it being hosed down by a man believed to be a Port of London Authoritystaffer, while a vet performed a check-up at the riverrsquos edge, before the Royal National Leboat Institutearrived at the scene to the cheers of onlookers around pm.Fire crews were also at the scene, along with the British Divers Marine Le Rescue service.Footage posted from the scene showed the whale finally being freed at about am.Glen Nicolaides from London Fire Brigade told the BBC the whale had been moved to a more ldquostable location where it would be assessed to determine the scale of its injuries and whether it could be released.Earlier, a witness told the PA news agency that ldquoquite the crowd watched as the attempted rescue took place. vw,vw,px, px"A man seen hosing down the whale Jake Manketo, , from Richmond, said: ldquoEveryone here is just hoping they get it out.ldquoWe couldnrsquot believe our eyes when we first saw the poor fella, not every day something like this happens in Richmond.It is believed the whale was first spotted at midday a few miles up the river near Barnes Bridge. vw, px"The RNLI was cheered on arrival to the scene A spokesman for the PLA, which owns and operates the lock, said: ldquoAt around pm on Sunday, a small whale, approximately -m long, believed to be a Minke whale, became stranded at Richmond Lock and Weir.ldquoPLA staff have attempted to assist the whale with water along with British Divers Marine Le Rescue.Minke whales are the smallest of the great whales, growing to about m.They can usually befound throughout the northern Atlantic and Pacic Oceans.     Their range extends from the ice edge in the Arctic during the summer to near the equator during winter.The lock is situated between Teddington and Richmond, comprising three vertical steel gates suspended from a footbridge..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Small whale freed after becoming stranded along River Thames article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: lockdown uk latest changes four nations
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityHere is an update on measures across the four nations and what further changes are expected. vw,vw,px, px"Boris Johnson is due to announce that the next phase of lockdown easing can go ahead in England on May  ndash What will be dferent in England Mr Johnson is likely to say people are free to meet friends and family in parks, gardens and other outdoor areas, as the legal limit on outdoor gatherings is raised to  people.Outdoor arenas will be able to host live events with a maximum number of , attendees, or for large outdoor seated venues where crowds can be spread out, up to ,.Gatherings inside homes are likely to be allowed once again, with a limit of up to six people or groups from a maximum of two households.Indoor recreation is expected totoo, with the reopening of cinemas, sports and indoor seating at pubs and restaurants." data-title"HEALTH Coronavirus" https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production bfaefcbbfceeYudGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNjIwNzQwMTM ..jpg w w" sizes" vw,vw,px, px"As well as doing away with the pm curfew, no substantial meal will be required for patrons to enjoy a pint, but they must order, eat and drink while seated to avoid queues at the bar.Mr Johnson is expected to update the advice on social distancing which may mean hugs with loved ones will be permitted.Cabinet minister Michael Gove told Sky News on Sunday that ldquointimate contact between friends and family is something we want to see restored.As part of a further review into wider social-distancing policies, the mandatory stay at home order for workers may also be scrapped. vw,vw,px, px"Cabinet minister Michael Gove told Sky News on Sunday that lsquointimate contact between friends and family is something we want to see restoredrsquo This may not come into effect on May , but is expected before the following phase easings on June .     Britons are currently permitted to travel to a handful of approved ldquogreen list countries without having to quarantine, provided they take one post-arrival test.ndash What about Wales Gyms, leisure centres and swimming pools have been open again for a week in Wales following further easing of the Covid- restrictions on May .Organised childrenrsquos indoor activities and indoor adult fitness classes have resumed and two households are able to form an exclusive bubble and meet indoors.An announcement on any further easing of coronavirus lockdown restrictions in Wales is due to be made on Friday following discussions on Monday.Welsh indoor hospitality and all tourism accommodation is also expected to reopen from May .From today, two households can join together to create an extended household lsquobubblersquo #This means you can spend time together indoors, including staying over, without needing to socially distance.Read our guidance #https:t.co VlMuyAKZuv pic UejCkabWfUmdash Welsh Government #KeepWalesSafeMay , No plans on international travel have been announced by the Welsh government, but UK Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said he expects the rules will be ldquobroadly similar to those for English tourists.Welsh Labour housing minister Julie James confirmed on Sunday that foreign holidays were ldquovery much part of the package of discussion.ndash And in Scotland Scotland moved from Level  to Level  of the Scottish Governmentrsquos five tiers of restrictions on April , following continued suppression of the virus.Funerals and weddings, including post-funeral events and receptions, are allowed to take place with up to  people and alcohol permitted.Travel between Scotland, England and Wales is allowed and tourist accommodation has welcomed back visitors.Cafes, beer gardens, non-essential shops and museums have been reopened as well as gyms, swimming pools, libraries and museums. vw,vw,px, px"Cafes, beer gardens, non-essential shops and museums were reopened on April , as well as gyms, swimming pools, libraries and museums People are able to meet others for a meal or drink, with up to six people from two households allowed to socialise indoors in a public place such as a restaurant.But hospitality is required to close at pm indoors, and alcohol is only allowed to be served outside.The Scottish Government is currently facing a legal challenge over the restrictions by trade body Night Time Industries Scotland, which argues continuing measures are ldquono longer justiable or proportionate, and a breach of the Human Rights Act.Further easing of restrictions in Scotland is also expected on May  which will allow more socialising indoors and outdoors and further reopening of indoor venues with capacity limits.ndash What about Northern Ireland Non-essential retail and outdoor hospitality resumed in Northern Ireland on April .Curfews on takeaways and off-licences were removed and gyms and swimming pools have also reopened for inidual activities.The limit on outdoor gatherings in domestic gardens has been increased to  people but these can be from no more than three households.Self-contained tourist accommodation, such as caravans and rented holiday homes, can also operate." data-title"Coronavirus " data--holder"PA Wire" data--notice"PA Wire PA Images" data-credit"Mark Marlow" data-usage-terms"" the public enjoy a drink and a meal in Belfast More restrictions are set to be lted on May , although these are subject to review.From that date, pubs and restaurants can operate indoors, people will be allowed to gather in homes, and indoor attractions can reopen.Other tourist accommodation such as hotels and BBs can also reopen.Wedding receptions and post-burial events can take place in indoor
